page.title: 18Strensall School - Changes
page.content: {The Robert Wilkinson Voluntary {Controlled Primary School, Strensall has seen many changes during the last 40 years. The number of pupils has risen from{150 to 300. }Until 1972 the school was housed in a Victorian building with four classrooms, each holding an average of 40 children. There was{no hot water and the toilets {were outside. }P.E. was taken in the playground resulting in many grazed knees. There was no playing field. Sports Day was held on the road outside the school. Boys with whistles stood on each corner to warn of oncoming traffic. Later, P.E. was done in the Village Hall and Sports Day was held on a field a mile away. The first school secretary was appointed in 1960, working in the Headteacher's room which was so {overcrowded}people walked on the desks
